text:
Pros:
- Lokasi strategis, walking distance ke Galaxy Mall, KONI, dan Kampus ITS
- Parkir basement luas dan ada direct akses ke lift hotel
- Kamar Executive luas (81m2) dengan living room dan dapur terpisah, lengkap dengan elektronik dan peralatan dapur dan alat makan
- Kamar mandi dilengkapi dengan bathtub dan rainshower
- Kamar standar bintang 5
- Hotel staff yang ramah, dan kerap membantu saya selama menginap di hotel, salah satu yang saya ingat adalah ibu Yunita di Reception

Cons:
- Meski menginap di lt 11 suara kendaraan dari jalan kerap masuk
- Remote TV agak sulit dioperasikan dan sulit untuk mengakses youtube & netflix meski smart TV
- Siang ke sore agak hangat, disarankan menutup korden karena cahaya matahari  langsung masuk ke kamar
- Tidak ada kid's pool, hanya ada kolam renang dewasa dengan kedalaman 1.2m
- Menu sarapan bergaya Indonesia, cukup variatif namun tidak sebanyak bintang 5 pada umumnya

text: pertama karena saya bukan orang sby, saya browsing di Trip Advisor mendapatkan salah satu rekomendasi yaitu hotel ini. Cukup dekat dengan lokasi bisnis yang saya tuju (20 menitan, ternyata jauh menurut orang Sby). Diseberang ada super!nd@ dan resto padang, jalan kaki 10 menitan ke galaxy mall, jadi pilihan yang cukup wajar  karena saya sambil membawa keluarga. Pertama masuk kamar langsung terkejut dengan ruangan yang luas dengan tempat tidur yang besar. Interior modern minimalis (cocok selera saya), ada kursi bekerja, meja makan, sofa panjang yang nyaman (bisa untuk ditiduri), pemandangan bagus mengarah ke lapangan koni dan kota surabaya (apalagi klo malam). Terdapat meisn kopi nesc@f#, hair dryer, Baju mandi, papan setrika dan setrika serta perlengkapan makan sendok garpu pisau dll (sudah jarang sekali ada di hotel). Handuk dan perlengkapan terlihat bersih. Protokol kesehatan dijalankan, tidak pernah bertemu orang tanpa masker, sarapan juga selalu diingatkan untuk menggunakan sarung tangan plastik saat mengambil makanan. Saya yg tinggal lebih dari hari harus menyampaikan hasil test swab antigen ( yang menurut saya bagus sekali untuk berjaga2). parkiran cukup luas dan mudah mengaksesnya. Sarapan memang tidak terlalu banyak macamnya, tapi sudah cukup (ada salad sayur segar). Kolam berenang kedalaman 120 cm, dan  tidak ada kolam berenang kecil untuk balita. Internet cukup kencang, untuk anak sekolah online dan browsing  sangat memadai. Oiya, untuk kamar premier, terdapat mesin cuci, dapur, kulkas, perlengkapan makan lengkap, meja makan, dan ruang keluarga. Secara keseluruhan, sangat puas dengan staycation/Business trip kali ini. WIlll definitely go back!

text:
+ Interior kamar sangat homey sekali.
+ Banyak sekali teknologi dan item yg ada dikamar dan saya rasa disurabaya tidak teknologi seperti itu. (Subwoofer, Payung,Mesin Kopi, Guest Service Tablet (Bisa Pesan apapun via tabel yg disediakan dikamar). Ada Shoe polish. Bisa minta Timbangan secara free.
+ Harga mini bar sangat wajar dibandingkan Hotel bintang 5 lainnya.
+ Harga Laundry yang sangat Masuk akal.
+ Breakfast tiap hari beda menu.(Makanan overall sangat worth dengan tambah harga "100rb" saat pemesanan kamar).
+ Pool + Gym sangat nyaman digunakan.
+ Pengamanan sangat berlapis. CCTTV gede gede haha. Tiap titik banyak metal detector.
+ Senyum dan disapa tiap bertemu dengan staff tiap lantai. Sangat Friendly
+ Capuccino sangat maknyuss. Ndak pernah ada hotel yg kopinya seenak ini.

- Ada misskoordinasi, pada saya cek in hari pertama saya mendapatkan kamar yang belum dibersihkan sama sekali. Akan tetapi langsung diganti dengan kamar yang baru di Top Floor walaupun agak sedikit menunggu.
- Tiket Parkir Mobil tiap masuk harus distempel. Mungkin bisa diubah dengan mendaftarkan plat nomor alias didata.

Overall Good Service and Good Place for Stay in Surabaya. I will be back soon.

text:
Stay for 3 nights in two bedrooms apartments at 9th floors during “Nyepi” day. 
This hotel ( I might say instead of service apartment ) consider newly open. Since they open on last September 2018 for public. 

The room was nice and comfy. 
What I like was they provide very complete amenities especial on the kitchen area. 
From the high tech stove, oven, microwave to dish washer and amazing crystal glasses from wine, champagne, beer to whiskey glass by Schott Zweissel. Kids should be aware not to break the glass easily...

One thing, The hotel hospitality was the main strength of this hotel could cover their some lacking. 
Thank you for Mr. Sumarno ( Executive Chef ) and Mr. Erwin ( duty manager ) who gave so much hospitality to my family and we really appreciated. 

During our stay, we were facing some issues which need some improvements. 

1. The second bathroom was unclogging and the water came outside the walk in shower. 

2. Every time we entered the hotel area by car, the securties always ask with “what can I do for you? Where are you going? Can I help you?” Hellloooooo??? We were hotel guests and every time people enter to the hotel should have their own common reasons. I think the securties just need do their jobs for checking cars instead of asking many questions like we enter to the presidential place. I didn’t feel homey with it. 

3. The spice restaurant was quite messed up especially when they served table for breakfast they ( maybe ) forgot to gave the complete cuttelery such as lack of fork etc. I took a picture and shown above. 

4. Item checking when checked out also need improvement. After they checked, they were asking for a “lost” plate that we didn’t know about it and finally they found it after searching again. 
At first, they should remind or tell us to check the items listed on the paper when we checked in. But they didn’t. It should be checked at first. Too many cuttelery, any kind of alcohol glasses make complicated for check our process. 

There were still some issues need to be improved. Again, their hospitality could cover their lacking. 

I appreciate to their hospitality. 
Thank you for your hospitality to our family during our stay in your hotel. 

🙏
title: Nice serviced apartment but still needs some improvements

text:
The check-in lobby is on the top floor while the lower lobby is only for drop-offs. Didn't expect anything because I ordered the lowest room, apparently at check-in I was told that my room was double-upgraded from superior (44 m2) to executive (81 m2). If the superior type is just an ordinary room without a pantry, the executive type has a complete kitchen and equipment.

The room is very spacious consisting of 4 rooms, consist of the bedroom, bathroom, living and dining room, and kitchen. The rooms smells good and there is no damp smell at all. All equipment works fine 

For the living room there is a dining table equipped with 3 chairs, a long sofa and a small sofa with a large TV. The kitchen has a washing machine, oven, zinc, refrigerator, electric stove, coffee machine, toaster, kettle, rice cooker. Very complete and still looks all shiny. Tableware includes spoons, forks, chopsticks, knives, ladle, scissors, corkscrews, bowls, teapots, cething, plates, various glasses and mugs, pans. For bottled mineral water, 2 bottles of 600 ml are provided, coffee uses excelso coffee capsules, tea uses the Dilmah brand. Kitchen amenities are also very complete, namely sunlight and sponges, plus liquid soap is also provided for washing. So oakwood is perfect for those who long-stay or gather in parties with friends

The bedroom is also quite spacious, equipped with a cupboard, desk, work desk and chair. Adequate sized TV with digital viewing and wifi also runs smoothly. There are also many room sockets so you don't get confused if you bring lots of electronic equipment. The soft mattress is great for sleeping with 4 regular pillows and 2 decorative pillows. For the anniversary set, they are given a large slice of cake with an art towel. 

The bathroom is equipped with a bathtub, shower and rain shower, closet and sink. Towels are provided 2 bath towels and hand towels. Complete amenities for Budi Jaya production. The bathtub has clear water and fills up quickly, anti-drama.

Swimming pool, fitness and spa facilities are available on the F floor. The swimming pool is indoor and a bit dark, forget whether there is a children's pool or not. Complete fitness equipment, the brand is life fitness, each treadmill is also provided with its own TV. 

Breakfast at Oakwood starts at 06.00-10.00. The taste is quite suitable on my tongue and the variant are considered complete. Breakfast conditions are also crowded
1. Waffles and Pancakes
2. Indonesian Corner (Yellow rice, beans, noodles, fried chicken, Rawon)
3. Madura porridge (pearls, marrow, grendul, pandan, green beans)
4. Beverage (Coffee and tea, herbal medicine, infused water, juice (orange and guava))
5. Indomie Corner
6. Traditional snacks, pudding, rounds
7. Bakery Pastry (Croissant, Danish, bread, muffin, Sandwich)
8. Salad and fruit, Bircher muesli, yoghurt
9. Fried rice, fried noodles, vegetables, curry chicken, fish
10. Western (Fried Potatoes, Roasted Chicken, Baked Tomatoes, Baked Beans, Chicken and Beef Sausages)
11. Japanese and Korean (Kimchi, sushi, miso, mushi cup)
12. Dimsum and Chicken Carving

text:
Took a while to find the lobby entrance then parked the rented car.

Heard the name of Oakwood in Jakarta but never stayed. The one in Surabaya is located in a busy city area.

Greeted by friendly P Erwin and was pleasantly surprised that one of our 3 rooms was upgraded. We got even more surprised when entering the room we reserved. Sooo spacious. The bed was so comfy. We were so excited and happy.

Despite a slight aircon dripping from the ceiling above the table near the egg area, the breakfast was still mouth-watering. Each of us found what we loved. So many varieties.

Left the iphone in the room and it was still untouched. 

The services received from the minute we walked in until we checked out were nothing but friendly, helpful, n courteous.

Oakwood, you have made our stay one of the best highlights of our trip.

Thank you.
title: Oakwood? Let's give it a try...

text:
The property is marketed as a 5* property, but in reality, it is not. The room/apartment looked tired and worn out, bathroom was dirty with mould, the towels i guess used to be white when they were new but all looked grey and dirty. The bedsheets to my horror still had stains on them, definitely they were not properly washed. 

The breakfast was very local, with barely any international options and the quality was very mediocre. Only saving grace of my stay was the friendliness of the staff.

The property does not deserve it's 5* rating, 3* at most. I will not stay here again and for future visits in Surabaya I will stick to the Shangri-La, Westin or JW Marriott hotel.
title: Not a 5* property, 3* at most

text:
We tried to reserve a room via Whatsapp chat, but it took too long for the officer to respond us back.
Fyi, I have a voucher to stay 1 night at Oakwood.
Because of the really really late respond, we tried to reach out through phone, but only to found out that we cannot stay on the weekend although it is not written in the voucher's terms & condition.
This is slightly gave us a feeling that you guys were not welcoming a "voucher" guest, especially the officer in charge of the Whatsapp reservation didn't get back to us after we send them our voucher photo.

About the food.
I think it was Aglio e Olio... it's delicious but it was too dry, and I don't think it's cooked yet. We had a hard time to chew it.
The Rawon is quiet unpleasant for us, because it was full of fat. It's too greasy to even taste the Rawon flavour. And guess what? We got a big big chunk of Laos, instead of meat.

The WiFi is not that great too. Despite the easy access, it's still too laggy to the point that we cannot access the Instagram. (or maybe Instagram is banned on your internet system? Idk)

But despite all of those not-so-comfortable experiences, the whole stay experience is excellent! We think out of all the hotels that we've stayed, Oakwood is the only one to go max and beyond. I love how everything is available for the guest even the cutlery is complete. Maybe because of the long stay hotel concept, we feel like you have everything available inside the hotel room.

And oh! We went to the Deckside at night and found out there was a DJ. I love how the wind breeze and the music becoming one!
title: The most complete accomodation

text:
We stayed for 5 nights and the room we booked was really to my mother’s taste, the moment we walked in to the room she was all “this is it. next time we’re coming back to Surabaya we’re staying here!”

The room was spacious, clean, filled with a ton of natural light, and had a modern, studio-apartment feel to it with lots of storage spaces (a must for a family like mine). Everything was decorated nicely with nothing over the top. Love the massive TV right in front of the bed & the tablet on the desk to play some music/radio stations. Bathroom was not huge but spacious enough to move about, has a lot of counter and storage space as well (also very well lit, great for doing makeups!)

the staffs were very friendly and attentive. they were very helpful with directions and also provided hand-sanitizers at the counters (with the COVID-19 virus still spreading). Did a thermal check too, to insure everyone’s healthy & safe.

Only downside I can think of is probably the lack of variety of food for breakfast. The taste itself was okay, so it’s definitely something the hotel can improve on.

On a side note, we’d like to thank Mr. Adam Maulidin the duty manager for always being attentive and checking up on us. He sat down with us and was willing to listen thoroughly to our suggestions & advices regarding the hotel’s services, which was great. Most hotels would just give us a piece of questionare for a review. 

We are definitely coming back to stay at Oakwood Hotel and hope to meet you again, Mr. Adam! All the best for Oakwood Hotel’s future endeavors.
title: Modern, Clean, and Spacious Room; Overall a Great Stay!

text:
It was an enjoyable stay for 2 nights at the hotel. the room was spacious, lots of shelves and very clean. The amenities were excellent, however it would be so much helpful if a simple instruction on how to use the Unakafe coffee machine was made available. 
For the comfort of the bed and pillow, I would rate 7 out of 10 for the bed and only 4 for the pillow. 
The breakfast overall tasted good but for a five star hotel, the variant of food should be more. Coffee tasted great. 
Staff at the check in counter, restaurant, lobby (including driver for shuttle service) and room service were friendly and very attentive to customer needs. Location wise, it was very close to Galaxy Mall and the city centre.
title: Superb Hotel with a little improvement is needed

text:
This is my 2nd visit to this hotel since last March 2019.

Back to the hotel with my family again, I feel some improvements. The hotel hospitality is one of the most strength and value for this hotel. From entrance to the lobby we were greeted warmly by their staffs.
Check in process were pleasant, especially I was handled by Mr. Erwin (duty manager) who always care of my stay since my 1st stay.

They really pay attention to their exterior and interior hotel and took care of it. Cleanliness rooms and bathrooms are outstanding but a little bit pity at the lobby there were some unpleasant smell when I was checking out.

One thing I would give a suggestion is try not to call at 12 noon for every room on checking out day, it feels like a cheap or budget hotel by doing that. Oakwood is 5 stars hotel / service apartment. Please be 5 stars on service how you should, don't be a budget hotel.
title: Well maintained service apartment

text:
We rented a 2-bedroom apartment for our 3 night stay at this new property in East Surabaya. Although a bit out of the city centre getting a Grab taxi at any hour never seemed to be a problem. Situated at a major intersection the property is close to the Galaxy Malls. A regular shuttle to the Malls was provided.  The property opened about 3 months ago and offers about 140 accommodation units of which about 70 were ready for occupation.

We arrived on the street or ground level, entered through sliding glass doors and had to go through security screening (similar to the airport)  and then take the lift up to the lobby level where the reception, lounge and restaurant (Spices) are located.  Check-in was prompt and efficient as you are seated comfortably in the adjoining lounge and welcome chilled drinks are served.  My mother travelled in a wheelchair and asked for a hot drink and the staff promptly arranged for this. She was also reading a coffee table book on flower arrangement and the receptionists remarked she could take it back to our apartment to read at her leisure.

Our 2 bedroom apartment unit number 809, measured  about 110 sq metres and was well  furnished and laid out with up to date and quality fittings.  The apartment was furnished with a long dining table, comfortable lounge, generously sized kitchen (microwave, large full sized refrigerator, full sized oven, induction glass stove top, dishwasher, coffee maker with complimentary supplies, rice cooker, dishwashing liquid, etc. A complete set of cutlery, crockery and cooking utensils and pots and pans were included - sufficient for a dinner party of 6 to 8 guests. Lighting intensity in almost all areas of the apartment could be varied via dimmers. A washing machine cum dryer was located just outside the second bedroom. The master bedroom featured a large kind sized bed, wardrobe and generous ensuite bathroom with a bathtub and stand alone shower.  The second bedroom featured twin beds, wardrobe,  large writing desk and its own ensuite bathroom with a walk in shower.  There were ample electrical outlets to charge your electronic devices and flat screen TVs in the lounge and each of the bedrooms. The floor and all work surfaces were clean and free of dust. A tablet for personal use was placed in lounge. Air conditioning was efficient and the wifi was stable.

The choice of offerings at the buffet breakfast was not extensive but the quality can be rated as average. We also dined in on our day of arrival and were pleased with our ala carte orders.  My mother did not find croissants were then not in the pastry selection at breakfast and we made a remark to the staff who mentioned that she would see if they could get hold of a few  the next day. For our remaining stay they specially set aside some croissants for us.

Everything was complete within the apartment and the only time  assistance was required was to operate the washing machine.

Staff at all levels were polite, courteous and helpful except for a couple of younger staff on the ground floor when we first arrived on the late afternoon of Thu 7 Feb 2019 - they did not seem very enthusiastic to see us and appeared to be a bit lethargic seeing the amount of luggage and the wheelchair accompanying us. That was the only poor impression.  I remarked this to the receptionist at check-in and I don't recall seeing this same set of people again.

The gym is well equipped and maintained.  My only real disappointment was the covered pool in which I tried to do my laps in but found it too cold or chilly every single time.  Because it is covered the pool area  has a relatively low ceiling it appears dark or dim.  I hope the management will employ some form of solar heating for the pool. I have a back problem and need to swim regularly for exercise and the cold chilly temperature does not help.   I understand that a spa is in the process but disappointed to learn that it will NOT include a sauna/steam room.  One East is a set of similar apartment units located on one side of the same block as the Oakwood Residences and  features its own roof top (and hence  warmer water) and it would appear that they may be managed by a  group affiliated to Oakwood.  I had requested one of the male receptionists in Oakwood to seek permission from the management of One East, to see if I could get permission to use their pool. This was apparently declined. Perhaps the receptionist was too junior or did not have enough clout.....I should have perhaps sought the assistance of the General Manager of Oakwood.
title: A Rating of 8.5 out of 10.0
